title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Wemyss derives its name from the number of caves on this part of the coast — Weem or Wemyss being tlie Gaelic word for a cave.

title: Scotland Picturesque and Traditional. A pilgrimage with staff and knapsack
author: Todd, George Eyre.
snippet: In the ancient ivied kirk of Weem a curious mural monument,perhaps the most elaborate in Scotland, marks the burial-place and commemorates thevirtues of six generations of the mothers of the house of Weem.

title: Scotland Picturesque and Traditional. A pilgrimage with staff and knapsack
author: Todd, George Eyre.
snippet: Highagainst the heavens, on theleft, looms Schichallion, theFairy Mountain; and lowerdoAvn, darkening the strath,hangs the Hill of Weem, Avithits ogre-haunted uamh, or cave,and its famous Avishing-Avell*Then lights begin to shineamong the shadows of the
